title: Haine is professor of Physical Oceanography at Johns Hopkins University. His overall research interest is the fundamental understanding of the physics of the basin-scale ocean and its role in earth’s climate. He is involved in improving estimates of the geophysical state of the ocean circulation through analysis of field data and circulation model results. He has published more than 75 research articles and reports
